5.69. 
Division of the estate
1. No one may be compelled to waive his right to the division of his share. The division of the estate shall be effected by common accord of the heirs.
2. The estate may not be divided:
(1) before the birth of the heir at law or under the will;
2. if the testator has fixed in his will a time-limit within which the heirs shall hold the inheritance jointly. This period may not exceed five years from the date of the occurrence of the succession, except in the case of minors among the heirs. In that case, the testator may prohibit the division of the estate until the heir reaches the age of eighteen.
